title: Getting help with pcapkg
text: Thanks using pcapkg! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with pcapkg
text: can’t reproduce bug, can’t fix ! Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (excellent ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help!.

title: Getting help with pcapkg
text: Armed reprex, next step figure ask: ’s question: start community.rstudio.com /StackOverflow. people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place -> file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers, :pr, :closed, etc., needed, e.g. ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Introduction to pcapkg
text: perform principal component analysis (PCA) matrix high-dimensional proteomic data. generate “scree”-plot top variances pca class object. plot specific rotation projection space objects various “getter” functions retreive features PCA.

title: Introduction to pcapkg
text: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) 2-dim data matrix, via decomposition variance-covariance matrix (SVD). modification standard stats::prcomp() performed. Data transformations (e.g. centering /scaling) can performed via arguments.
code: pr <- pca(pcapkg:::log10_ft(simdata)) pr #> ── PCA Object ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Rotation                 40 x 49 (PC1:PC40) #> Projection               100 x 56 (PC1:PC40) #> Projection variables     '.id', 'id', 'class_response', 'reg_response', 'time', 'status', 'SampleId', 'SlideId', 'Subarray', 'SiteId', 'age', 'gender', 'HybControlNormScale', 'NormScale_40', 'NormScale_0_005', 'NormScale_1' #> ═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

title: Introduction to pcapkg
text: convenient plotting methods rotation projection spaces.

title: Introduction to pcapkg
code: plot(pr, "r", identify = TRUE)

title: Introduction to pcapkg
code: plot(pr, "p", color = SiteId)                   # unquoted string! plot(pr, "p", color = SiteId, id.labels = id)   # with labels

title: Introduction to pcapkg
code: rot  <- plot(pr, "r", identify = TRUE) proj <- plot(pr, "p", color = SiteId, id.labels = id) +   theme(legend.position = "top") rot + proj

title: Introduction to pcapkg
code: a <- plot_scree(pr, n = 10L) b <- plot_scree(pr, n = 10L, type = "l") a + b

title: Authors and Citation
text: Stu Field. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Field S (2025). pcapkg: Perform PCA Analysis Data. R package version 0.0.1, https://stufield.github.io/pcapkg.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pcapkg: Perform PCA Analysis of Data},   author = {Stu Field},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://stufield.github.io/pcapkg}, }

title: Perform PCA Analysis of Data
text: pcapkg package contains general functions necessary unsupervised exploratory analysis high-dimensional proteimic data using Principal Component Analysis (PCA). primary tools package dedicated either calculation principal components, visualization loadings projections components.

title: Perform PCA Analysis of Data
text: possible install specific version pcapkg
code: # current dev version remotes::install_github("stufield/pcapkg")  # or a specific version remotes::install_github("stufield/pcapkg@v0.0.1")

title: Perform PCA Analysis of Data
text: load pcapkg simply make call library() usual:
code: library(pcapkg)

title: Perform PCA Analysis of Data
code: library(help = pcapkg)

title: Get PCA Names — get_pca_names
text: Determine names features (rotation) samples (projection) /specified cutoff (value) principal component dimension specified dim.

title: Get PCA Names — get_pca_names
code: get_pca_names(x, type = c("rotation", "projection"), dim = 1L, value)

title: Get PCA Names — get_pca_names
text: x pca class object. See pca(). type character(1). Matched. Either "rotation" "projection". dim integer(2). PCA dimension select. value numeric(1). value corresponding dimension interrogate names.

title: Get PCA Names — get_pca_names
text: character string corresponding feature names exceed value dimension dim.

title: Get PCA Names — get_pca_names
text: Stu Field

what: Get Top Features by PCA Dimension — get_top_pca_rotation
title: Get Top Features by PCA Dimension — get_top_pca_rotation
text: Interrogates rotation dimension defined dims orders features value principal components dimension. dimension represented column resulting data frame.

title: Get Top Features by PCA Dimension — get_top_pca_rotation
code: get_top_pca_rotation(x, dims = 1:5L, n = 30L)

title: Get Top Features by PCA Dimension — get_top_pca_rotation
text: x pca class object. dims integer(n). Vector dimensions interrogate. n integer(1). limit many features report (.e. rows resulting data frame).

title: Get Top Features by PCA Dimension — get_top_pca_rotation
text: data frame top features ordered principal components given selected dimension.

title: Get Top Features by PCA Dimension — get_top_pca_rotation
text: Stu Field, Michael R. Mehan

title: Get Top Features by PCA Dimension — get_top_pca_rotation
Principal Component Analysis — pca
text: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) proteomic data matrix, via decomposition variance-covariance matrix (SVD). modification standard prcomp() performed. Data transformations (e.g. centering /scaling) can performed via arguments. plot_scree() function generates "scree plot" pca class object.

title: Principal Component Analysis — pca
code: pca(data, features = NULL, center = TRUE, scale = FALSE)  # S3 method for class 'pca' print(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'pca' plot(   x,   type = c("projection", "rotation"),   dims = 1:2L,   color,   identify = FALSE,   id.labels,   ... )  plot_scree(   x,   n = min(15L, length(attributes(x)$sdev)),   type = c("barplot", "lines") )

title: Principal Component Analysis — pca
text: data data.frame (tbl_df) class object. features character(n). columns consider features. center logical(1). features/variables zero centered prior decomposition? general performed variables space, thus defaults TRUE. scale logical(1). features scaled unit variance prior decomposition? TRUE, corresponds PCA correlation space opposed covariance space. x pca class object. ... Additional arguments passed geom_point(). type Either "projection" (default) "rotation". called plot_scree(), either "barplot" (default) "lines". matched. dims integer(2). dimensions plot. color unquoted string indicating variable x$projection color points . Required projection plots. identify Logical. Identify points? rotation space, top 10 target names dimension identified. id.labels unquoted string indicating variable x$projection containing point labels. Ignored rotation plots. n integer(1). number components plot.

title: Principal Component Analysis — pca
text: pca class object, similar prcomp().

title: Principal Component Analysis — pca
text: print(pca): S3 print method pca class objects. plot(pca): S3 plot method pca class objects.

title: Principal Component Analysis — pca
text: Stu Field

title: Principal Component Analysis — pca
code: pca <- pca(pcapkg:::log10_ft(simdata))  # print method pca #> ── PCA Object ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Rotation                 40 x 49 (PC1:PC40) #> Projection               100 x 56 (PC1:PC40) #> Projection variables     '.id', 'id', 'class_response', 'reg_response', 'time', 'status', 'SampleId', 'SlideId', 'Subarray', 'SiteId', 'age', 'gender', 'HybControlNormScale', 'NormScale_40', 'NormScale_0_005', 'NormScale_1' #> ═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════  # S3 plot methods plot(pca, "r")                         # default rotation  plot(pca, "r", identify = TRUE)        # label targets   plot(pca, "p", color = class_response) # default samples projection  plot(pca, "p", color = gender)         # use "gender" for colors  plot(pca, "p", color = class_response, id.labels = id) # label points  plot(pca, "p", color = class_response, alpha = 0.5)    # adjust point alpha #> Warning: Duplicated aesthetics after name standardisation: alpha  # Scree plots plot_scree(pca)               # barplot  plot_scree(pca, type = "l")   # lines  plot_scree(pca, type = "l")

what: pcapkg: Perform PCA Analysis of Data — pcapkg-package
title: pcapkg: Perform PCA Analysis of Data — pcapkg-package
text: package contains general functions necessary unsupervised exploratory analysis high-dimensional proteomic data using Principal Component Analysis (PCA). Primary tools related calculation principal components visualization loadings projections components.

title: pcapkg: Perform PCA Analysis of Data — pcapkg-package
text: Maintainer: Stu Field stu.g.field@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder]

title: Plot A PCA Dimension — plot_pca_dims
text: Plots either projection loadings (rotation) "prcomp" object. base function wrapped driver parent functions plotting principal components, notably plot_rotation() plot_projection().

title: Plot A PCA Dimension — plot_pca_dims
code: plot_pca_dims(   data.prcomp,   value = c(NA, "rotation", "x"),   dims,   classes,   main = sprintf("PCA Plot (%s)", ifelse(value == "x", "projection", value)),   scores = NULL,   col = NULL,   xlab = NULL,   ylab = NULL,   legend_pos = "right",   xlim = NULL,   ylim = NULL,   pt_cex = 2.5,   pt_pch = 19,   add_ellipse = FALSE,   ... )

title: Plot A PCA Dimension — plot_pca_dims
text: data.prcomp prcomp class object. Typically object returned prcomp2(). value Character. type plot generated. projection enter "x", rotation enter "rotation". dims integer(2). dimensions plot. classes Optional. vector indicating classes observations (either features samples) used coloring points, depending whether rotation projection plotted. Must length plot type, .e. number samples projection features rotation. main character(1). string containing title plot. scores Optional. Statistical scores pass coloring points plotting. training data set passed scores = NULL, KS-distances (scores) calculated hood used determine point color. Can either single value (e.g. "red") vector color values length number observations. overrides point color assigned classes . col character(1). color points. Can either single value (e.g. "red") vector color values length number observations. parameter overrides point colors determined classes scores parameters . xlab character(1). string indicating label x axis. ylab character(1). string indicating label y axis. legend_pos character(1). Position legend, plotted. Options include "left", "right", "bottom", "top", "none" legend desired. Ignored value = "r" (rotation) classes specified. xlim numeric(2). Optional limits x-axis format c(0, 0). ylim Numeric. Optional limits y-axis format c(0, 0). pt_cex numeric(1). Character expansion points. pt_pch numeric(1). Shape points. Accepted values 0-25. add_ellipse Logical. ellipse added rotation? Ignored projection (value = "x"). ... Additional arguments passed geom_point().

title: Plot A PCA Dimension — plot_pca_dims
text: points plot either rotation projection space.

title: Plot A PCA Dimension — plot_pca_dims
text: Stu Field, Michael R. Mehan

title: Plot A PCA Dimension — plot_pca_dims
code: # Prepare data pca <- center_scale(pcapkg:::log10_ft(simdata), center = TRUE, scale = FALSE) |>   feature_matrix() |>   prcomp2() scores <- withr::with_seed(101, rnorm(40))  # Rotation space, with scores to define point colors plot_pca_dims(pca, value = "r", dims = 1:2L, classes = NULL,               scores = rnorm(40))   # Projection space, with classes to define point colors plot_pca_dims(pca, value = "x", dims = 1:2L,               classes = simdata$class_response)

title: Plot PCA Projection — plot_projection
text: Plot samples PCA projection 2-dimensional scatter plot.

title: Plot PCA Projection — plot_projection
code: plot_projection(   data.prcomp,   dims = 1:2L,   classes = NULL,   scores = NULL,   col = NULL,   samples = NULL,   pt_cex = 2.5,   ... )

title: Plot PCA Projection — plot_projection
text: data.prcomp prcomp class object. Typically object returned prcomp2(). dims integer(2). dimensions plot. classes Optional. vector indicating classes samples used coloring points. Must length number samples. scores Optional. Statistical scores pass coloring points plotting. training data set passed scores = NULL, KS-distances (scores) calculated hood used determine point color. Can either single value (e.g. "red") vector color values length number observations. overrides point color assigned classes . col character(1). color points. Can either single value (e.g. "red") vector color values length number observations. parameter overrides point colors determined classes scores parameters . samples Optional. vector sample IDs mark projection plot. Specified samples marked hollow diamond (see pch()). pt_cex numeric(1). Character expansion points. ... Additional arguments passed plot_pca_dims().

title: Plot PCA Projection — plot_projection
text: Stu Field, Michael R. Mehan

title: Plot PCA Projection — plot_projection
code: pca <- center_scale(pcapkg:::log10_ft(simdata), center = TRUE, scale = FALSE) |>   feature_matrix() |>   prcomp2()  # Define color of points plot_projection(pca, col = "green")   # Use classes to define point colors plot_projection(pca, classes = simdata$class_response)   # Mark specific samples plot_projection(pca, samples = rownames(simdata)[1:5L])

title: Plot PCA Rotation — plot_rotation
text: Plot features PCA rotation 2-dimensional scatter plot. Note: precedence ordering coloring follows: col scores

title: Plot PCA Rotation — plot_rotation
code: plot_rotation(   data.prcomp,   dims = 1:2L,   classes = NULL,   scores = NULL,   col = NULL,   set1 = NULL,   set2 = NULL,   set3 = NULL,   set4 = NULL,   set5 = NULL,   lab_cex = 3,   pt_cex = 2.5,   auto_ident = TRUE,   ... )

title: Plot PCA Rotation — plot_rotation
text: data.prcomp prcomp class object. Typically object returned prcomp2(). dims integer(2). dimensions plot. classes Optional. vector indicating classes features used coloring points. Must length number features. scores Optional. Statistical scores pass coloring points plotting. training data set passed scores = NULL, KS-distances (scores) calculated hood used determine point color. Can either single value (e.g. "red") vector color values length number observations. overrides point color assigned classes . col character(1). color points. Can either single value (e.g. "red") vector color values length number observations. parameter overrides point colors determined classes scores parameters . set1 Optional. vector feature ids mark plot. Typically vector analytes clinical relevance, e.g. sample handling. Marked hollow diamond (see pch()). set2 Optional. additional vector feature ids mark plot, separately set1. Marked hollow triangle (see pch()). set3 Optional. additional vector feature ids mark plot, separately set1. Marked hollow square (see pch()). set4 Optional. additional vector feature ids mark plot, separately set1. Marked hollow circle (see pch()). set5 Optional. additional vector feature ids mark plot, separately set1. Marked hollow upside-triangle (see pch()). lab_cex numeric(1). Font size point labels generated auto_ident. auto_ident must TRUE. pt_cex numeric(1). Character expansion points. auto_ident logical(1). top 10 features, dimensions, identified labeled plot? ... Additional arguments passed plot_pca_dims().

title: Plot PCA Rotation — plot_rotation
text: Stu Field, Michael R. Mehan

title: Plot PCA Rotation — plot_rotation
code: pca <- center_scale(pcapkg:::log10_ft(simdata), center = TRUE, scale = FALSE) |>   feature_matrix() |>   prcomp2() plot_rotation(pca, col = "green")   class <- withr::with_seed(123, sample(simdata$class_response, 40L)) plot_rotation(pca, classes = class)   y <- withr::with_seed(123, sample(pcapkg:::get_analytes(simdata), 10L)) plot_rotation(pca, set1 = y)

title: Principal Component Analysis — prcomp2
text: Performs principal components analysis given data matrix returns results prcomp class object. function "borrowed" stats::prcomp(), except extra returned components SVD returned standard function well hard coding projection returned simple data checks.

title: Principal Component Analysis — prcomp2
code: prcomp2(x, tol = NULL)

title: Principal Component Analysis — prcomp2
text: x numeric complex matrix (data frame) provides     data principal components analysis. tol value indicating magnitude components     omitted. (Components omitted     standard deviations less equal tol times     standard deviation first component.)  default null     setting, components omitted (unless rank. specified     less min(dim(x)).).  settings tol     tol = 0 tol = sqrt(.Machine$double.eps),     omit essentially constant components.

title: Principal Component Analysis — prcomp2
text: prcomp class object.

title: Principal Component Analysis — prcomp2
text: simply hijacked prcomp() added elements return value.

title: Principal Component Analysis — prcomp2
text: Stu Field, Mike R. Mehan

title: Plot AUC Dependent Screeplot — screeplot_auc
text: Plot screeplot variance bars colored according AUC corresponding classes specified training response vector.

title: Plot AUC Dependent Screeplot — screeplot_auc
code: screeplot_auc(   data.prcomp,   auc.classes,   auc.proj = NULL,   main = NULL,   nPCs = 20L,   ... )

title: Plot AUC Dependent Screeplot — screeplot_auc
text: data.prcomp prcomp class object. Typically object returned prcomp2(). auc.classes vector training classes used calculating AUC. auc.proj alternative projection matrix another decomposition. default, projection data.prcomp used. main character(1). string containing title plot. nPCs integer(1). Number PCs plot. ... Additional arguments passed geom_col().

title: Plot AUC Dependent Screeplot — screeplot_auc
text: Stu Field, Michael R. Mehan

title: Plot AUC Dependent Screeplot — screeplot_auc
code: pca <- center_scale(pcapkg:::log10_ft(simdata), center = TRUE, scale = FALSE) |>   feature_matrix() |>   prcomp2() screeplot_auc(pca, simdata$class_response, main = "My ScreePlot by AUC")
